author: daxian-dbw

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Is this change manual or automated?  Would it make sense (for a separate PR) to have the name of the release stored in a single file that is picked up by all these scripts?

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: This is a manual change. The file `tools/download.sh` probably will be deleted soon as we have moved to `tools/install-powershell.sh`. According to Travis, the file `download.sh` is kept for now just in case. As for the Dockerfiles, I'm not if it's doable to make them read the name from a file, @TravisEz13 could you please weigh in?

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: I submitted this PR targeting master branch by mistake. I have rebased the `release` branch against `master`.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: I still have a case where download.sh is needed, but I plan to fix it and then remove it.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: I take it back... I didn't need the script in the end, but I should still fix the issue.

comments.author: mirichmo
comments.body: Is a .spelling update needed as well?

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: No need to update spelling. The Travis CI passed (see CI run details by clicking `'View details'`).

title: Update docs and scripts for beta.6 release
